body:
> The go command can't embody every work flow. 

Looking at test coverage is not just "embodying every work flow". This is a fundamental feature advertised by the tool but implemented for machines not for human users.

> Why is that too hard?

The promise of the tool is to provide coverage, yet it only provides coverage readable by machines. I would expect the Go tool to be human-first.

It still can output a coverprofile to be consumed by other tools. But the user of the Go tool is primarily a human. And I don't know why we need to depend on an alias to achieve something that is commonly required. The current situation only encourages users to write more makefiles or create aliases replace the go tool.
